        Returns:
        creatures like that name

      • fetchByName

        Creature fetchByName(java.lang.String name)
        Fetches the creature with the name using an equality check. May or may not be case-sensitive. If multiple creatures have the same name, the result should be treated as if it was chosen randomly.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the creature
        Returns:
        a creature with that name or null

      • fetchByTemperature

        java.util.List<Creature> fetchByTemperature(int temperatureId)
        Fetch the creatures that live in the specified temperature
        Parameters:
        temperatureId - the temperature id
        Returns:
        the creatures that can live in that temperature, or an empty list

      • fetchByEnvironmentAndTemperature

        java.util.List<Creature> fetchByEnvironmentAndTemperature(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> environments,
                                                          java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> temperatures)
        Fetch the creatures that can live in some combination of the specified environment ids and temperature ids. For example, if the environments are forests and swamps, and the temperatures are temperate and tropical, the result would contain creatures that can live in temperate forests, tropical forests, temperate swamps, or tropical swamps.
        Parameters:
        environments - the environments
        temperatures - the temperatures
        Returns:
        a list of creatures or an empty list
